message.content:
Step 1. Calculate Free Cash Flow (FCF)  
• FCF combines the net cash flows from operating and investing activities.  
• FCF = Net Cash Flow from Operating + Net Cash Flow from Investing  
• From the cash flow statement:  
  Operating: –81,548.37  
  Investing: –676,195.87  
• FCF = –81,548.37 + (–676,195.87) = –757,744.24  

Step 2. Calculate Return on Assets (ROA)  
• ROA = (Net Profit / Average Total Assets) × 100%  
• Total Assets at beginning = 13,000,000.00; end = 14,823,650.85  
• Average Total Assets = (13,000,000.00 + 14,823,650.85) / 2 = 13,911,825.425  
• Net Profit = 1,095,371.35  
• ROA = (1,095,371.35 / 13,911,825.425) × 100 ≈ 7.88%  

Step 3. Calculate Return on Equity (ROE)  
• ROE = (Net Profit / Average Owner’s Equity) × 100%  
• Owner’s Equity at beginning = 13,000,000.00; end = 14,095,371.35  
• Average Equity = (13,000,000.00 + 14,095,371.35) / 2 = 13,547,685.675  
• ROE = (1,095,371.35 / 13,547,685.675) × 100 ≈ 8.09%  

Step 4. Calculate Operating Cash Flow to Net Income Ratio  
• Ratio = Operating Cash Flow / Net Profit  
• = –81,548.37 / 1,095,371.35 ≈ –0.07445, rounded to –0.07  

Step 5. Calculate Net Profit Margin  
• Net Profit Margin = (Net Profit / Total Revenue) × 100%  
• Total Revenue = 5,565,589.48  
• = (1,095,371.35 / 5,565,589.48) × 100 ≈ 19.69%  

Step 6. Calculate Gross Profit Margin  
• Gross Profit Margin = (Gross Profit / Total Revenue) × 100%  
• Gross Profit = 2,545,589.48; Total Revenue = 5,565,589.48  
• = (2,545,589.48 / 5,565,589.48) × 100 ≈ 45.76%  

Thus, the final answer in JSON format is:

{
  "solution": {
    "Free Cash Flow (FCF)": "-757744.24",
    "Return on Assets (ROA)": "7.88%",
    "Return on Equity (ROE)": "8.09%",
    "Operating Cash Flow to Net Income Ratio": "-0.07",
    "Net Profit Margin": "19.69%",
    "Gross Profit Margin": "45.76%"
  }
}
